noun.description: An African bush shrike (songbird) with the upper parts mainly blackish in color. It is noted for the duet of bell-like calls produced by the male and female together.
A long, colorful, loose-fitting garment worn by both sexes in parts of Africa.

origin: French: boubou (sense 1) probably imitative of its call; boubou (sense 2) from Malinke bubu.
